Participants.evidence: The Pediatric Heart Networkâ€™s Infant Single Ventricle trial database identified participants who underwent SCPA.

Objective.evidence: Objectives: We sought to identify factors associated with timing and surgical outcomes of the superior cavopulmonary anastomosis (SCPA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Factors potentially associated with age at SCPA, length of stay (LOS) and death by 14 months of age were evaluated.

Number_Randomised.evidence: SCPA was performed in 193 subjects at 5.2 (IQR 4.2, 6.2) months of age and weight of 5.9 (IQR 5.3, 6.6) kg.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Age at SCPA was associated with center and interstage adverse events. Longer LOS was associated with younger age and greater case complexity.

Harms.evidence: There were 3 deaths and 1 transplant during SCPA hospitalization and 3 deaths and 3 transplants between discharge and 14 months of age.
